title: What is phantom traffic and why is it ruining your life? - Benjamin Seibold

multiple-choice.question: What is a phantom traffic jam?

options.label: A
options.text: A traffic jam caused by an accident or a change in speed limit

options.label: B
options.text: A traffic jam that occurs when a large number of cars are on the road

options.label: C
options.text: A traffic jam that occurs when it is raining

options.label: D
options.text: A traffic jam that occurs when it is snowing

multiple-choice.question: What is the critical density of cars on the road that causes dynamic instability?
What is the main cause of phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A
options.text: Drivers' inability to maintain a consistent speed and spacing from other drivers

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of drivers braking harder to avoid collisions?

options.label: C
options.text: Having no effect on the wave of braking

options.label: D
options.text: Reducing the number of cars on the road

options.label: C
options.text: Having no effect on the wave of braking

options.label: D
options.text: Reducing the number of cars on the road

multiple-choice.question: What technology may be able to counteract phantom traffic in real-time?

options.label: A
options.text: Self-driving cars equipped with data on traffic conditions ahead from connected vehicles or roadway sensors

What is the main benefit of self-driving cars in preventing phantom traffic?

options.text: They can drive faster than human drivers

options.label: B
options.text: They can maintain a uniform speed that matches the average speed of the overall flow

options.label: C
options.text: They can reduce the number of cars on the road

options.label: D
options.text: They can change lanes more frequently

multiple-choice.question: What is the impact of phantom traffic jams on the environment?

options.label: A
options.text: They have no impact on the environment

options.label: D
options.text: They have a neutral impact on the environment

multiple-choice.question: What is the main cause of fatalities and wasted resources due to phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A
options.text: Drivers' inability to maintain a consistent speed and spacing from other drivers

title: Do politics make us irrational? - Jay Van Bavel

multiple-choice.question: What is partisanship?

options.label: A
options.text: A strong preference or bias towards any particular group or idea.

multiple-choice.question: What is cognitive dissonance?

options.label: A
options.text: A state of comfortable tension between two compatible thoughts.

options.label: B
options.text: A state of uncomfortable tension between two incompatible thoughts.

options.label: C
options.text: A state of indifference between two thoughts.

options.label: D
options.text: A state of excitement between two thoughts.

multiple-choice.question: What can lead to policies that are not grounded in truth or reason?
What is the trend towards clustering geographically in like-minded communities?

options.label: B
options.text: A trend towards clustering geographically in like-minded communities.

options.label: A
options.text: A growing tendency to rely on neutral news or social media.

options.label: B
options.text: A growing tendency to rely on partisan news or social media.

options.label: C
options.text: A growing tendency to rely on international news.

options.label: D
options.text: A growing tendency to rely on local news.

multiple-choice.question: What is the first step in resisting the distortion filter?

options.label: C
options.text: Making fact-checking and questioning assumptions a valued part of the culture.

multiple-choice.question: What is the second step in resisting the distortion filter?

options.label: B
options.text: Making fact-checking and questioning assumptions a valued part of the culture.

options.label: C
options.text: Warning people that they might have been presented with misinformation.

multiple-choice.question: What can help make people more receptive to persuasion?

options.label: B
options.text: Framing the issue in their language.

multiple-choice.question: What is the problem of partisanship?
What is the goal of the strategies for resisting the distortion filter?

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease fact-checking and questioning assumptions.

options.label: C
options.text: To keep people better informed and capable of making evidence-based decisions.

options.label: C

options.label: A

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: D
